questions.question_text: What role has the privileges to create and manage data shares by default?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text: Which function determines the kind of value stored in a VARIANT column?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Typeof returns the type of a value stored in a VARIANT column

Selected Answer: D
Reports the type of a value stored in a VARIANT column. The type is returned as a string.


https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/functions/typeof

questions.question_text: What operation can be performed using Time Travel?

choices.C: Creating a clone of an entire table at a specific point in the past from a permanent table
choices.B: Extending a permanent table’s retention duration from 90 to 100 days
choices.A: Restoring tables that have been dropped from a data share
choices.D: Disabling Time Travel for a specific object by setting DATA_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS to NULL

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Time Travel in Snowflake allows you to create a clone of a table at a specific point in the past, which is useful for recovering data or analyzing historical data.

Using Time Travel, you can perform the following actions within a defined period of time:

Query data in the past that has since been updated or deleted.

Create clones of entire tables, schemas, and databases at or before specific points in the past.

Restore tables, schemas, and databases that have been dropped.

choices.B: Directory tables can only be used with an external stage.
choices.A: Directory tables are separate database objects.
choices.E: A directory table can be added to a stage when the stage is created, or later.
choices.D: Directory tables store file-level metadata about the data files in a stage.
choices.C: Directory tables contain copies of staged files in binary format.

questions.question_text: What are characteristics of Snowflake directory fables? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A. Directory tables are separate database objects. —> No, they are not the separate objects
B. Directory tables can only be used with an external stage. —> No, it supports both internal and external stages 
C. Directory tables contain copies of staged files in binary format. -> No, it stores file URLs
D. Directory tables store file-level metadata about the data files in a stage. -> Yes
E. A directory table can be added to a stage when the stage is created, or later. -> Yes

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-load-dirtables#Both%20%external

questions.question_text: What does the VARIANT data type impose a 16 MB size limit on?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct C - The VARIANT data type imposes a 16 MB size limit on individual rows.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/semistructured-considerations
